com.appdynamics.apm.appagent.api

Interface ITransactionDemarcator


  • public interface ITransactionDemarcator
    This interface provides an API for Java applications to integrate with AppDynamics business transaction management. It can be accessed by all classes in the application as it will be on the bootstrap classpath.

    The API allows users to programmatically control transaction boundaries with single and multi-threaded applications across distributed tiers.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String APPDYNAMICS_TRANSACTION_CORRELATION_HEADER
      Key name to retrieve AppDynamics Transaction Correlation Header from JMS Message Header properties.

    • Method Detail

      • beginExternalCall

        java.lang.String beginExternalCall(java.lang.String invokedServiceIdentifyingName,
                                   java.lang.String invokedServiceDisplayName,
                                   boolean synchronous)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Marks the beginning of an external service call uniquely identified by the service identifying name parameter. The external call is associated with the business transaction executed by the current thread. This method starts the timer for measuring the execution time of the external call.

        On server side use beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread API to continue the transaction.

        If the caller is not waiting for external call invocation to complete (e.g. has a semantics similar to JMS send(Message msg) api) the synchronous parameter should be set to false.

        On server side use beginContinuingTransaction API to continue the transaction.

        Parameters:
        invokedServiceIdentifyingName - the name uniquely identifying the service being called
        invokedServiceDisplayName - the display name of the service being called
        synchronous - true if the caller is waiting for external call to respond before proceeding, false otherwise
        Returns:
        a string containing the AppDynamics transaction header to be propagated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invokedServiceIdentifyingName is null

      • beginExternalCall

        java.lang.String beginExternalCall(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> invokedServiceIdentifyingProperties,
                                   java.lang.String invokedServiceDisplayName,
                                   boolean synchronous)
        Marks the beginning of an external service call uniquely identified by the service identifying properties. The external call is associated with the business transaction executed by the current thread. This method starts the timer for measuring the execution time for the external call.

        On server side, use beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread API to continue the transaction.

        If the caller is not waiting for external call invocation to complete (e.g. has a semantics similar to JMS send(Message msg) api), the synchronous boolean should be set to false.

        On server side, use beginContinuingTransaction API to continue the transaction.

        Parameters:
        invokedServiceIdentifyingProperties - (mandatory) the properties uniquely identifying the service being called
        invokedServiceDisplayName - (mandatory) the display name of the service being called
        synchronous - true if the caller is waiting for invoked service to complete execution before invoking, false otherwise
        Returns:
        a string containing the AppDynamics transaction header to be propagated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invokedServiceIdentifyingProperties is null or empty

      • endExternalCall

        void endExternalCall(boolean error,
                     java.lang.String errorDetail)
        Marks the end of an external service call. It records the total execution time and error details if any for the call.
        Parameters:
        error - true if any error occurred during the execution of the external call, false otherwise
        errorDetail - the string containing a detailed message about the error

      • beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread

        java.lang.String beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread(java.lang.String appDynamicsTransactionHeader,
                                                               java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction)
        Marks begin of a transaction on cuerrent thread identified by the correlation id appDynamicsTransactionHeader originating from a remote JVM . If the transaction begins and ends on different threads, then it is preferred to use beginContinuingTransaction API instead.

        This method starts measuring time for the transaction activity on this JVM and records the total time till endContinuingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread is called on the current thread. This method also starts capturing the call graph of the caller thread. If additional threads need to participate in this global transaction, they need to invoke addCurrentThreadToTransaction and removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction with the transaction instance identifier.

        This method should be called only once for a given appDynamicsTransactionHeader.

        Parameters:
        appDynamicsTransactionHeader - the AppDynamics transaction correlation header propagated from remote JVM
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - (deprecated) AppDynamics picks up the unique id from the transaction header
        Returns:
        a string containing the unique transaction instance identifier. Returns null if transaction was not started successfully

      • beginOrContinueTransactionAndAddCurrentThread

        boolean beginOrContinueTransactionAndAddCurrentThread(java.lang.String transactionName,
                                                      java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction,
                                                      java.lang.String txHeader,
                                                      java.lang.String entryPointType)
        This method would be called from messaging system like JMS/Kafka where messages are received and iterated over a loop. This would check whether to begin a new transaction or continue the existing one. Transaction would begin in case of Cross-App scenarios and in other scenarios it should continue.

      • endContinuingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread

        boolean endContinuingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread()
        Ends transaction activity tracking on a JVM for a continuing transaction. This must be invoked in the same thread as beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread. It will record the total time for the transaction activity.

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Returns:
        true if the transaction ended successfully, false if no current thread has no active transaction

      • endContinuingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread

        boolean endContinuingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread(java.lang.Throwable unhandledError)
        Method to end transaction activity tracking on a JVM for a continuing transaction. This must be invoked in the same thread as beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread. It will record the total time for the transaction activity.
        Parameters:
        unhandledError -
        Returns:
        if the transaction ended successfully, false if no current thread has no active transaction. All internal errors are logged in agent log files

      • getUniqueIdentifierForTransaction

        java.lang.String getUniqueIdentifierForTransaction()
        Returns the unique transaction instance (current request) identifier for the transaction associated with the current thread, or NULL if transaction is not initialized yet. To associate a worker thread with the global transaction addCurrentThreadToTransaction API should be invoked by the worker thread with this transaction instance id.

        The identifier should not be used for correlating transactions across different tiers.

        Returns:
        a transaction id for current thread

      • setUniqueIdentifierForTransaction

        boolean setUniqueIdentifierForTransaction(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the unique transaction instance identifier for the transaction on the originating tier to the user defined id. This API should be called only from the thread that begins the transaction using api or transaction match rules (controller UI / agent XML) and before any threaded activity is initiated with this transaction (i.e. before addCurrentThread API is invoked with the unique transaction instance identifier).
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - the user defined unique transaction instance identifier
        Returns:
        true if the new transaction id was set successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if uniqueIdentifierForTransaction is null

      • addCurrentThreadToTransaction

        boolean addCurrentThreadToTransaction(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction,
                                      java.lang.String activityName,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> activityProperties)
        Adds a thread's activity to a currently executing global transaction activity on a JVM. This method starts measuring the execution time for this particular thread's activity and also starts capturing call graph information and should preferably be called before the thread starts processing any business logic.

        The total execution time is recorded when the removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction is called.

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - the identification information for the transaction this thread is a part of
        activityName - the logical name for this activity visible in call graph user interface. This is an optional information and can be set later using the setActivityNameForCurrentThread
        activityProperties - the map representation of any properties for this activity that need to be viewed in the visualization for the call graph for this thread. This is an optional information for this call and can be set later using the addPropertiesForCurrentThread
        Returns:
        true if current thread was successfully added to the multi-threaded transaction, false otherwise

      • removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction

        boolean removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction(java.lang.Throwable thrownException)
        Removes the current thread activity from the transaction.

        This should be called after the thread has finished processing all of the business logic This stops capturing the call graph information and records the total time for this activity.

        Parameters:
        thrownException - the thrown exception during current thread activity
        Returns:
        true if current thread was removed from the multi threaded transaction, false if current thread has no active transaction

      • removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction

        boolean removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction(java.lang.String context,
                                           java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Removes the current thread activity from the transaction.

        This should be called after the thread has finished processing all of the business logic This stops capturing the call graph information and records the total time for this activity.

        Parameters:
        context - (nullable) the context in which the thread was run
        throwable - (nullable) the error occurred during the execution of the thread, if any
        Returns:
        true if current thread was removed from the multi threaded transaction, false if current thread has no active transaction

      • setActivityNameForCurrentThread

        boolean setActivityNameForCurrentThread(java.lang.String activityName)
        Sets the logical name for the current thread activity. This should be called only after the current thread has been added to the transaction.

        This will overwrite any previous activity name, if set.

        Parameters:
        activityName - the logical name for this activity, easy way to identify the activity in call graph UI
        Returns:
        true if activity name was successfully set to the current thread, false if no active transaction for current thread

      • addPropertyForCurrentThread

        boolean addPropertyForCurrentThread(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String value)
        Adds a property for the current thread's activity. This should be called only after the current thread has been added to the transaction.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for the property
        value - the value for the property
        Returns:
        true if property was set to current thread, false if if no active transaction for current thread

      • addPropertiesForCurrentThread

        boolean addPropertiesForCurrentThread(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
        Adds properties for the current thread's activity. This should be called only after the current thread has been added with a transaction , these will be added to any previously set properties fro the current activity.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties to be added
        Returns:
        true if property map was set to current thread, false if if no active transaction for current thread

      • extractTransactionHeaderFromJMSMessage

        java.lang.String extractTransactionHeaderFromJMSMessage(java.lang.Object jmsMessage)
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Extracts AppDynamics transaction correlation header from a JMS Message. This identifier is a part of the JMS header property of the message payload, set by AppDynamics agent in the JMS message sender JVM. The correlation header is input to beginContinuingTransaction api.

        The header can also be extracted by using javax.jms.Message.getStringProperty(String APPDYNAMICS_KEY) api

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Parameters:
        jmsMessage - the javax.jms.Message received on this tier
        Returns:
        a string representation of the AppDynamics transaction header for the transaction. Returns NULL if any errors were encountered while processing the message object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed is not an instance of javax.jms.Message

      • beginContinuingTransaction

        java.lang.String beginContinuingTransaction(java.lang.String appDynamicsTransactionHeader,
                                            java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction)
        Marks begin of a multi threaded transaction originating from a remote JVM and identified by the correlation id 'appDynamicsTransactionHeader'. If the transaction begins and ends on same thread then prefer to use beginContinuingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread api instead.

        The second parameter is a unique transaction instance id shared by all threads that participate in this global transaction. This method starts measuring time for the multi threaded transaction activity on this JVM and records the total time when the endContinuingTransaction is called with the transaction instance identifier.

        The calling thread is not associated with the transaction, hence if the calling thread's activity needs to be captured then addCurrentThreadToTransaction and removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction must be invoked explicitly on current thread.

        To mark the end of the transaction endContinuingTransaction needs to be invoked. (from any thread) with the transaction instance identifier.

        This method should be called only once for a given appDynamicsTransactionHeader.

        Parameters:
        appDynamicsTransactionHeader - the AppDynamics transaction correlation header propagated from remote JVM
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - (deprecated) unique id which AppDynamics picks up from the transaction header
        Returns:
        value of appDynamicsTransactionHeader supplied as a parameter

      • endContinuingTransaction

        boolean endContinuingTransaction(java.lang.String appDynamicsTransactionHeader)
        Ends multi-threaded transaction activity tracking on a JVM. This will record the total time for the transaction activity.

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Parameters:
        appDynamicsTransactionHeader - the AppDynamics transaction correlation header propagated from remote JVM
        Returns:
        true if the multi-threaded transaction successfully ends, false otherwise

      • beginOriginatingTransaction

        java.lang.String beginOriginatingTransaction(java.lang.String transactionName,
                                             java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts a new multi-threaded transaction on this JVM by name transactionName.

        This signals the start of a multi-threaded transaction and the transaction instance identifier will be the common identification for all threads that intend to participate in this global transaction. This method starts measuring time for the transaction activity on this JVM and records the total time when the endOriginatingTransaction is called with the transaction instance identifier.

        The calling thread is not associated with the transaction, hence if the calling thread's activity needs to be captured then addCurrentThreadToTransaction and removeCurrentThreadFromTransaction must be invoked explicitly on current thread.

        Parameters:
        transactionName - the name of the business transaction
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - the unique transaction instance identifier for all threads which are a part of this transaction. If null, the system generates a new id that can be retrieved using getUniqueIdentifierForTransaction
        Returns:
        a string containing the unique transaction instance identifier. Return null if transaction was not started successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if transactionName is empty

      • endOriginatingTransaction

        boolean endOriginatingTransaction(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction)
        Ends multi-threaded activity tracking on a JVM for a transaction originating in the same JVM. This will record the total time for the transaction activity.

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - the identification for this transaction
        Returns:
        true if the multi-threaded transaction has successfully ended, false otherwise

      • beginOriginatingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread

        java.lang.String beginOriginatingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread(java.lang.String transactionName,
                                                                java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction)
        Starts a new transaction on current thread by name transactionName. The name will be visible as the business transaction name in controller dashboards.

        The unique transaction instance identifier will be the common identification information for all threads that participate in this unit of work. The transaction is associated with the current thread. This method starts measuring time for the transaction activity on this JVM and records the total time when the endOriginatingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread is called. on the same thread. This method also starts capturing the call graph of the caller thread if applicable. The addCurrentThreadToTransaction method needs to be called from all threads whose execution time and activity call graphs need to be captured adn associated with the this transaction.

        Parameters:
        transactionName - the name of the business transaction
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - unique transaction instance identifier for all threads which are a part of this transaction. If null, the system generates a new id that can be retrieved using getUniqueIdentifierForTransaction
        Returns:
        a string containing the unique transaction instance identifier. Return null if transaction was not started successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if transactionName is empty

      • beginOriginatingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread

        java.lang.String beginOriginatingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread(java.lang.String transactionName,
                                                                java.lang.String uniqueIdentifierForTransaction,
                                                                java.lang.String entryPointType)
        Starts a new transaction on current thread by name transactionName. The name will be visible as the business transaction name in controller dashboards.

        The unique transaction instance identifier will be the common identification information for all threads that participate in this unit of work. The transaction is associated with the current thread. This method starts measuring time for the transaction activity on this JVM and records the total time when the endOriginatingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread is called. on the same thread. This method also starts capturing the call graph of the caller thread if applicable. The addCurrentThreadToTransaction method needs to be called from all threads whose execution time and activity call graphs need to be captured adn associated with the this transaction.

        Parameters:
        transactionName - the name of the business transaction
        uniqueIdentifierForTransaction - unique transaction instance identifier for all threads which are a part of this transaction.
        entryPointType - type of entry point (JMS/POJO etc.) If null, the system generates a new id that can be retrieved using getUniqueIdentifierForTransaction
        Returns:
        a string containing the unique transaction instance identifier. Return null if transaction was not started successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if transactionName is empty

      • endOriginatingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread

        boolean endOriginatingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread()
        Ends transaction activity tracking on a JVM for a transaction originating in the current thread. This will record the total time for the transaction activity. This must be invoked in the same thread as beginOriginatingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread.

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Returns:
        true if the transaction ended successfully, false if no current thread has no active transaction

      • endOriginatingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread

        boolean endOriginatingTransactionAndRemoveCurrentThread(java.lang.String context,
                                                        java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Ends transaction activity tracking on a JVM for a transaction originating in the current thread. This will record the total time for the transaction activity. This must be invoked in the same thread as beginOriginatingTransactionAndAddCurrentThread.

        Note: all internal errors are logged in agent log files.

        Parameters:
        context - (nullable) the context in which the thread was run
        throwable - (nullable) the error if any during execution on current thread
        Returns:
        true if the transaction ended successfully, false if no current thread has no active transaction
